column13: and aÂ â€œfanâ€ decided that drawing a ship they didnâ€™t like was worthy of attempted murder. column1: hazels-lullaby 160990870131 "2017-05-23 17:53:04 GMT" https://hazels-lullaby.tumblr.com/post/160990870131/how-to-play-paranoia "poorlytimedboner: This is literally the best party game ever ok so hereâ€™s what you do: Everyone sits in a circle Whoever goes first whispers a question to the person on their right The person on the right must answer the question out loud. The trick is
column2: no one else in the circle knows the question.Â  Next
column3: someone flips a flip-flop up in the air.Â  If it lands face up: the asker must say the question out loud to the whole group If the flip flop lands face down: the asker doesnâ€™t say anything
column4: and everyone in the group is left to wonder what in the world the question was.Â  And you go around the circle like that. The best questions have the answers as people. We like to limit it just to peopleÂ inÂ the circle
column5: too. It just makes it more fun.Â  Here are some examples of good questions: You have to cover someone in the circle completely in peanut butter and lick it all off. Who? You and one other person must be surgically bound together for the rest of your life. Who is the other person? You and someone in the circle go in a dark room for 1 hour and do unspeakable things. Who? the creepy sexual ones are the best
column6: and itâ€™s really fun when you limit it to people in the circle. have fun " False text

column1: hazels-lullaby 160990856706 "2017-05-23 17:52:34 GMT" https://hazels-lullaby.tumblr.com/post/160990856706/shorthand-google-reference-guide "ashhavynn: Iâ€™m gonna type this up while itâ€™s fresh on my mind because some of yâ€™all donâ€™t know how to use GoogleSO YOU WANT TO DRAWA woman sitting in the grass.IF YOU SEARCH: female sittingVery vogue. Very male gaze. Good for fashion or model pictures
column2: not very good if youâ€™re wanting to draw a natural looking pose on a woman who isnâ€™t a model and whose camera certainly didnâ€™t fucking turn on by itself.IF YOU SEARCH: female sitting poseArguably worse
column3: depending on the use. My experience withÂ â€œfemale + poseâ€ searches is that you get a lot of IMVU and The Sims pose sets
column4: and artists making sketch compiliations thatâ€¦ donâ€™t always have great anatomy and are frequently just more stiff model poses. I do use similar searches for pinup sketches
column7: â€ thoughÂ â€œposing for pinup photographyâ€ andÂ â€œhow to pose forâ€ will give different results if you arenâ€™t finding what you need.IF YOU SEARCH: woman student relaxing sitting on grass crossed legsCloser. Still kind of staged looking. Maybe we donâ€™t want her studying. Maybe we just want her relaxing. Still
column8: you start to see how specific keyword searches will really get you results.IF YOU SEARCH:Â woman sitting under tree grass relaxing nature summerNice. This is only a small handful of the results
column9: but most of them more or less fit my mental image. Mostly stock images
column10: but good for gesture sketches or figuring out a pose. Stillâ€¦ we could go further
column11: and I think I will.IF YOU SEARCH:Â woman sitting under tree grass relaxing nature summer senior photographyJackpot. Senior pictures arenâ€™t always awkward kids in braces. Look at how much more natural a few of these look? Compare that to theÂ â€œFemale sittingâ€ search. Google Search tip #1 is basically â€œuse more and specific keywords.â€But justâ€¦ one more thing I justâ€¦ canâ€™t get off my mindâ€¦ what if Iâ€¦ justâ€¦IF YOU SEARCH: blackÂ   woman sitting under tree grass relaxing nature summer senior photography  Uh oh. So let me level with you
column13: â€ expect a lot of white people. I spent over 30 minutes adding keywords to this search
column14: and every page was still white people. Breaking it back down toÂ â€œblack woman sitting on grassâ€ helped but gave me all the boring pose issues of the female sitting search. So basically
column15: Google Search tip #2 is: Google image search is as White as the rest of the damn world. How do we find what weâ€™re looking for now
column16: then?IF YOU SEARCH:Â black woman sitting in grass nature tumblr blackoutBeautiful
column17: natural poses. AddingÂ â€œphotographyâ€ whitewashed it. AddingÂ â€œsummerâ€ gave me bikini pinups. Searching for POC models using Google image search is infinitely more frustrating than finding a million thin white women
column18: and youâ€™re usually going to be better off supporting POC modeling blogs themselves than fighting with Google all day. UsingÂ â€œtumblrâ€ andÂ â€œinstagramâ€ as keywords may also get you a lot more natural
column19: less Vogue Was Here hits. Pinterest too
column20: on occasion.Â But keep in mind that these are real peopleâ€“especially using tags like â€œtumblrâ€ or â€œblackout.â€ Thereâ€™s a difference between referencing a pose or drawing different face shapes
column21: and outright copying someoneâ€™s exact likeness without their permission. Maybe also consider liking/reblogging/following them if theyâ€™re a model or photographer.Â Use some common sense. You donâ€™t own images found on google yadda yadda donâ€™t be a dick.Have fun being better at search engines and learning how to draw stuff!" False text
